data.title: Atlanta crime family
data.meta_description: The Atlanta crime family, also known as the Georgia Mob, the Atlanta Mob, or the Grossio family is an Italian-American Mafia (La Cosa Nostra) organized crime family based in Atlanta, Georgia. It was formed 1930 by Raymond "The Scholar" Agriguta. The Family would gain notoriety in the early 2000s...
data.text:
The Atlanta crime family, also known as the Georgia Mob, the Atlanta Mob, or the Grossio family is an Italian-American Mafia (La Cosa Nostra) organized crime family based in Atlanta, Georgia. It was formed 1930 by Raymond "The Scholar" Agriguta.

The Family would gain notoriety in the early 2000s by Philadelphia mob boss, Joseph “Skinny” Merlino. Once in Florida, Joey Merlino & the Grossio Family crew would work together from one state, to another.

The Family is no longer called the “Grossio Family” and is believed to have fallen under the Gambino Crime Family, one of the 5 Italian Mafia Families based out of New York. Most members are believed to now live in South Florida, as there is a lot more “action” to be made down there.

Joseph “Skinny” Merlino’s lawyers has insisted that he is no longer the acting boss of the crime family, but it’s hard to say when keeping in contact with other mob members.

More than 18 Italian mob arrests made in New York in major mafia crackdown[]

By Elisabetta Povoledo

World News

Eighteen suspects were detained in New York. Charges included association with organized crime, extortion, and fraudulent transfer of valuable goods.

Amongst the possible charges facing those detained were mafia conspiracy, extortion, loan sharking, corporate fraud and money laundering.

Around $10.36 million worth of real estate and other assets were confiscated by NYPD authorities.

Investigations also revealed how pervasive the influence of the mafia is in Brooklyn

According to New York police, the mafia not only engages in extortion there, but also has a large role in the city's legal economy -- with its involvement in business such as wholesale food supplies, online betting and gambling.

Those arrested include

Kenan Sijamija

Victor "Vic" Parnaglia (1961 - 1978)

Angelo Stanzo (1978 - 1980)

John "Jackie" Giacobbe (1980 - 1986)

Marco "Mikey" Formiace (1986 - 1992)

Frank "The Carriage Boy" Franda (1992 - 2008)

Martin "Marty Blanco" Tatto (2008 - 2010 was)

Current Leadership[]

Administration:[]

Boss: Cory Buice “Oliver”

Underboss: Casey Buice “Floyd”

Consigliere: David Blake Buice “Blake”

Historical Leadership[]

Boss: David Blake Buice sr 1970-2016.[]

Cory Buice 2016- Present “Oliver” 2016-2021

Known to be the idea man floating schemes that are backed by his brothers Casey “Floyd” Buice and his brother Blake Buice.

With the void left from FBI crackdowns on Italian decent traditional mafia members allowed for a takeover of white collar crime by the Buice “Bice” family.

Underboss: Casey “Floyd “Buice 2016 -2021[]
